review:
I have visited Dr kiran Reddy as one of my friends recommended him as a good knee specialist. I have been having knee pain since 6 months on and off, and have consulted a lot of orthopedics who have prescribed various pain medications, blood tests and MRI scans, I have also been offered a diagnostic laproscopy procedure for finding out what was wrong with my knee. Every time I took medications the pain went away for a few days but it returned as soon I went on with life. I have lost faith in doctors and wanted to try alternative medicine like homeopathy.

After I visited Dr Kiran Reddy, he patiently listened to all my problems and took a very detailed history of events from the beginning and including my childhood to correlate any similar events. He meticulously went through all my previous prescriptions,blood reports, x_rays and scans. He did a full body examination including my spine, foot other joints to omit all the conditions others might have missed. 

He found out that I had some issue with the hip on the same side as the movements were less and the hip was tight with little pain. Apparently the new hip x_rays showed some fluid in the joint causing it to move apart. He has nailed the problem with another MRI scan of the hip. It was pain from the hip which was showing as knee pain. The explanation finally did make some meaning to me.

Although the entire consultation took over 40 minutes to go through my old reports and scans, He also called up the concerned radiologist to discuss my MRI report. While he had patients to attend to, he gave me full attention I needed because I was running around hospitals from pillar to post till then. 

He gave me options for the treatment, and explained in detail their advantages and disadvantages. He also suggested that for my stage I should be fine with non surgical treatment along with some changes in my daily routine and lifestyle. 

I am doing fine now. I thank the doctor for his help and support.

review:
I had an ACL tear in my knee and went to Dr Kiran Reddy for the surgery as recommended by a colleague of mine.After some examination and tests he said that I will need a ACL reconstruction surgery, he explained the treatment options for the grafts and various implants and also suggested which is best for me as I like to be active.

I got operated by him and he made sure I was pain free and comfortable throughout the procedure and later on as well. He even allowed me to take my mobile into the operating theatre. He said I could watch the surgery on the laparoscopy monitor if I wanted to. The entire process was indeed stress free. Also, the period after surgery was also easy, I walked almost immediately with a brace and walker.

One thing to note is Dr.Kiran Reddy insists on very rigorous physiotherapy and follow up, he asks you before taking up the surgery itself if you are willing to dedicate time and effort for good results, but after seeing my friend who got the same surgery from him and is doing well, I can totally understand why. 

I am grateful to the doctor and his teammates including physiotherapist, nurses and insurance handlers for making my stay a pleasant experience. 

Looking forward to getting back to cycling soon as I can.

review: Consulted with the doctor in the emergency department because my elderly father had a bad fracture in the leg. He actually just fell at home from the ramp but both bones in the leg have shattered into multiple pieces. On top of all this, my father was also diabetic and his sugar level was also so high. The doctor explained various treatment types to me and my father and he also told how the period after the surgery should be. He was constatly in touch with the diabetic doctor to control my dads blood sugars, finally surgery was done only after the sugars were in control. We have opted for small incision surgery with strong titanium plates, My father is doing well now, sutures were removed and the the scar is normal.  He is not supposed to put weight on that leg for 4 weeks now. The doctor also prescribed a bone forming injection that has to be given everyday at home, which is just like insulin pen type. overall the surgery and post surgery went smoothly for us thanks to dr kiran reddy he took very good care of all the aspects of health of my elderly father, he is very helpful and informative for the treatment.

I highly recommend him for any knee related problems.

review: On May 2nd 2022, I had first consultation with Dr. Kiran Reddy as I was having a pain and discomfort in the wrist and hand mobilization. I had a 5th metarpal fracture on 1 Mar 2022 and had K- Wire cross fixation done on 2 Mar 2022 in AIG Hospital with a Different Orthopaedic Surgeon. As it is really difficult to catch the doctor who has done the surgery, I have decided to consult Dr Kiran Reddy at Kindle Clinics by reading very good reviews in practo.  Dr. Kiran diagnosed the root cause for the pain by prescribing few x-ray samples and few blood tests. He informed that I have a muscle loss in certain parts of the hand and due to the pop plaster the had got jammed with the lack of mobility. Also, he informed that i have a de quervain's tenosynovitis near right thumb. He suggested non invasive rigorous physiotherapy for 7 days and few medications and today i have completed the physiotherapy and the wrist and hand mobility improved a lot.  I liked the doctor way of diagnosis, identifying the root cause, patience, his non invasive methods, suggests only required treatments and avoids unnecessary panicking the patients etc. I would like to recommend the doctor for every one who are suffering with any orthopaedic disorders. Definitely you can trust the practo reviews regarding this doctor.
